required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mentors Offering Maternal Support (M-O-M-S™): A Prenatal Program for Decreasing Maternal Anxiety and Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Mentors Offering Maternal Support (M-O-M-S™): A Prenatal Program Building Maternal Self-Esteem, Coping, and Resilience and Decreasing Depression.

collaborator.agency: United States Naval Medical Center, San Diego

brief_summary.textblock: The M-O-M-S project evaluates the effectiveness of the M-O-M-S program for improving birth outcomes and maternal-infant attachment and role satisfaction in a large military sample.

detailed_description.textblock: The M-O-M-S project is a longitudinal, multi-site, randomized controlled trial to test program effectiveness for decreasing prenatal maternal anxiety and depression and increasing self-esteem and resilience and assess the relationship to pregnancy complications, birth outcomes, postpartum maternal-infant attachment, role satisfaction and parental stress.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Following consent, the participants will randomized to either the treatment or control groups using a computer-generated randomization table developed prior to study start. They will be randomized to either the MOMS intervention or prenatal care without the MOMS. Women randomized to the MOMS program will be assigned to a MOMS group in the first trimester.

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change between gestational weeks 12, 16, 22, 28, 32, and 37 of pregnancy
assessing change between gestational weeks 12, 16, 22, 28, 32, and 37 of pregnancy and 1, 3, & 6 months postpartum
primary_outcome.description: 10-item scale measuring the degree to which one values oneself

primary_outcome.measure: Family Adaptability and Cohesion Evaluation Scales
primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change between gestational weeks 12, 16, 22, 28, 32, and 37 of pregnancy and 1, 3, & 6 months postpartum
primary_outcome.description: 30-item instrument measuring the ability of the family (couple) to change its roles, rules, and power structure.

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change between gestational weeks 12, 16, 22, 28, 32, and 37 of pregnancy and 1, 3, & 6 months postpartum
primary_outcome.description: 10-item scale measuring prenatal or postpartum symptoms of depression

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change between gestational weeks 12, 16, 22, 28, 32, and 37 of pregnancy and 1, 3, & 6 months postpartum
primary_outcome.description: 17-item scale measuring the extent to which families are integrated into the community, view the community as a source of support, and feel that the community can provide emotional, esteem, and network support

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change between gestational weeks 12, 16, 22, 28, 32, and 37 of pregnancy and 1, 3, & 6 months postpartum
primary_outcome.description: 17-item instrument measuring the degree to which families feel committed to the military mission and identify a subscale of family coping to manage life changes and stresses

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change between gestational weeks 12, 16, 22, 28, 32, and 37 of pregnancy and 1, 3, & 6 months postpartum
primary_outcome.description: 6-item instrument developed to measure the concept of "bouncing back from stress."
82-items measuring the woman's perceived postpartum adaptation to motherhood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: delivery weight of infant documented at delivery
secondary_outcome.description: exact measure obtained from the delivery or infant record of the infants weight at birth in grams

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at first prenatal appointment up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Gestational age in weeks at birth determined from last menstrual period (LMP) and/or first trimester ultrasound

arm_group.description: M-O-M-S intervention is 10, 1 hour prenatal mentored support groups
Routine prenatal care in accordance with the Department of Defense Pregnancy Guidelines

intervention.description: 10, 1 hour, structured classes meeting every-other-week in person beginning in the first trimester of pregnancy and unlimited access to mentor support.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Prima or multigravida, first trimester of pregnancy at consent, greater than or equal to 18 years old, active duty, a wife of an active duty service member, or a retiree
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anticipated permanent change of station during the study (unless going to another one of the study sites or able to complete all treatment components prior to move), dependent daughter of active duty or retired military, greater than 12 weeks gestation at consent, less than 18 years of age and inability to understand English.

eligibility.gender_description: Pregnant military women in the first trimester of pregnancy

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Brigadier General Lillian Dunlap Endowed Chair

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data will be available to the local site PIs and to Department of Defense (DoD) OB Consultants. Study protocols are available upon request for DoD leaders within obstetrics.
